body: Can you reproduce the crash consistently? Does it crash if you specify a different `-datadir`?
Yes, in fact, I am unable to start the application without the crash.

@Rspigler 
To let others to reproduces a reported issue please provide:

- Fedora edition
- Fedora release
- machine's architecture
- desktop environment name and release

Fedora 28 (Workstation)
x86_64
GNOME 3.28.2

Specifically, I run Freed-ora (Linux-libre as my kernel)
cc @MarcoFalke Have you seen anything similar?

Are you able to run this in `gdb` and get a stacktrace?

Run `gdb bitcoin-qt`, then type `run` in the prompt, and when it crashes, type `thread apply all bt` and paste the output here.

Is this an official release binary or self-compiled?
This is an official verified binary
Could you share `bitcoind -debug -printtoconsole` output?

> This is an official verified binary

Ah, I believe you'd have to download the debug symbols as well to have useful backtraces.

@promag 

This is all I get:

> 2018-10-27T00:12:04Z Bitcoin Core version v0.17.0 (release build)

Bitcoin server starting

Then, I get a Bitcoin application crash report to ABRT
@MarcoFalke Hm, that means I must compile 0.17.0, right? For the debug symbols. Is there a way to download them?
Looks like you have `daemon=1` in your configuration. Try running `bitcoind -debug -printtoconsole -nodaemon`.

Yeah, I think they are not distributed on the website due to their size.

You can get it here: https://transfer.sh/wvPiC/bitcoin-0.17.0-x86_64-linux-gnu-debug.tar.gz

and then check the hash 

```
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA512

$ sha256sum ./bitcoin-0.17.0-x86_64-linux-gnu-debug.tar.gz
```

see also: https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gitian.sigs

@Rspigler could you also run with `-notxindex`:
```
bitcoind -debug -printtoconsole -nodaemon -notxindex
```

> zmq: Publish rawtx
